Artificial Intelligence
Artificial Intelligence

Artifical intelligence is the intelligence exhibited by machines and software. Although technically any intelligent agent is one that can perceive its environment and undertake actions that maximize its chances of success, colloquially the term refers to a machine or software that displays a notable degree of self-awareness and sentience, displaying a human-like level of intelligence. With the development of "smart" devices and other forms of cognitive technology, achieving this goal becomes a possibility, although there are some concerns that, as such intelligences may not think in a truly "human" fashion, they may become rivals or otherwise hostile towards humanity. Still, as intelligent behavior may be defined as being logical or human-like, it is also possible such new intelligences would be benevolent or friendly towards humanity, so long as humanity acted intelligently themselves.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]AI Networks[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I think, therefore I am"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Rene Descartes[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cybernetics
Cybernetics

Although cybernetics as a science is broadly concerned the study of systems of any nature which are capable of receiving, storing, and processing information so as to use it for control, its study of the connection between stimulus and action lends itself to the common perception of the study of interfaces between humans and machines, and how mechanical sensors and agents might be integrated with human decision-making processes. However, cybernetics can also be applied to such things as purely mechanical systems (studying artificial intelligence and emergent behavior), as well as biological and social systems.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hovertanks[ENDCOLOR], the most advanced mobile unit in the game, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Telepresence Hubs[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The world of the future will be an even more demanding struggle against the limitations of our intelligence, not a comfortable hammock in which we can lie down to be waited upon by our robot slaves." -- Norbert Weiner[NEWLINE][TAB]
Ecotheory

While environmentalism has been a social movement concerned with the preservation of nature against human activity, it does also have the drawback of regarding both "nature" and "humanity" as separate and distinct from each other. As the study of ecological systems progresses, increasing movements that seek to view both humans and their environment more holistically start to develop, encouraging people to view themselves as part of a single, unified system. Some of the more radical proponents of these new ecological philosophies (or "ecosophies") advocate that thought should be given to modifying both humans and the environment so they can live in greater harmony with each other -- with competing needs, simply preserving both humanity and the environment as they are is likely to lead to further conflict.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ecosanctuaries[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Biofactories[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Every living being is connected intimately, and from this intimacy follows the capacity of identification and as its natural consequences, practice of non-violence."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Arne Næss[NEWLINE][TAB]
Nanomaterials
Nanomaterials

Nanomaterials research takes a materials science-based approach to nanotechnology, leveraging advances in materials metrology and synthesis which have been developed in support of microfabrication research. Materials with structure at the nanoscale often have unique optical, electronic, or mechanical properties.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Power Armor Infantry[ENDCOLOR], a futuristic infantry unit, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nanomaterial Plants[ENDCOLOR] which provide Nanomaterials. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Generators[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Carbon atoms on a distant planet rearranged themselves into DNA, microorganisms formed, grew backbones, swam around the ocean, mutated into amphibians and crawled onto dry land — and finally a cab appeared at the mouth of the alley."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mark Coggins, "The Immortal Game"[NEWLINE][TAB]
Transgenics
Transgenics

As the technology to clone existing organisms matured, it also permitted the increasing development of new, genetically modified organisms that incorporated previously nonexistent traits that could breed true in future generations. Most transgenic organisms could only grow and develop under controlled environments, such as specialized plant nurseries, but new ecotheories helped scientists understand the complex interactions in ecologies and environments, allowing more stable transgenic organisms that could survive in open environments without upsetting the existing ecological balance.

You can build a genetic research complex to increase production, gold, and food output. Increases the gold output of ranches, fishing boats, farms, and camps. You can produce mutated units with great resilience.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mary Shelley, Frankenstein[NEWLINE][TAB]
Cloning
Cloning

The advancing study of biology and medicine lead to the creation of methods for artifical gestation, and manipulation of organisms on a cellular level. Once the ability to incubate organisms artifically in a laboratory environment was achieved, attention was turned to the capability to replicate particularly useful organisms, eventually leading to the search for some means to replicate an actual human being. Still, while it is possible to replicate an organism genetically, that organism may not mature into an identical twin of its predecssor, due to environmental influences.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Clone Labs[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aquaculture Labs[ENDCOLOR], which enhance nearby resources.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Why would you clone people when you can go to bed with them and make a baby? C'mon, it's stupid."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ray Bradbury[NEWLINE][TAB]
Genetic Engineering
Genetic Engineering

With the discovery of DNA, and the increasing ability to manipulate organisms on a genetic level, it was inevitable that some would investigate the effects of manipulating the genetic composition of organisms, in an effort to improve them in various ways. Genetic manipulation can be highly problematic, however, as even simpler organisms that have been genetically modified may prove to have unintended biological and environmental effects. The possibility of human genetic modification is an issue with many social and ethical concerns, although some feel the potential benefits would outweigh such risks.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mutants[ENDCOLOR], a cheap infantry unit that can heal itself, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gene Labs[ENDCOLOR], which provide a bonus to certain resources, as well as increasing the production of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot become what we need to be, remaining what we are."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Max De Pree[NEWLINE][TAB]
Supercomputers and Digitization
Supercomputers and Digitization

A supercomputer is a computer with a high-level computational capacity compared to a general-purpose computer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Supercomputers were introduced in the 1960s and the first supercomputers only used a few processors. In the 1990s, machines with thousands of processors began to appear and, by the end of the 20th century, massively parallel supercomputers with tens of thousands of "off-the-shelf" processors were the norm.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Supercomputers play an important role in the field of computational science, and are used for a wide range of computationally intensive tasks in various fields, including quantum mechanics, weather forecasting, climate research, oil and gas exploration, molecular modeling (computing the structures and properties of chemical compounds, biologicalmacromolecules, polymers, and crystals), and physical simulations (such as simulations of the early moments of the universe, airplane and spacecraft aerodynamics, the detonation of nuclear weapons, and nuclear fusion) and would eventualy leads to the Digital revolution, also knows as the 4th industrial revolution that has been occurring since the middle of the last century. It is characterized by a fusion of technologies that is blurring the lines between the physical, digital, and biological spheres that include technologies like artifical intelligence, augmented reality, virtual reality, blockchain, cryptocurrency, 3D printers, big data, robotics, etc... As the physical, digital, and biological worlds continue to converge, new technologies and platforms will increasingly enable citizens to engage with governments, voice their opinions, coordinate their efforts, and even circumvent the supervision of public authorities. Simultaneously, governments will gain new technological powers to increase their control over populations, based on pervasive surveillance systems and the ability to control digital infrastructure, would profoundly impact the nature of national and international security, affecting both the probability and the nature of conflict.

You can build e-commerce servers that increase your city's gold output. You can build a cyber police station to increase your city's security. You can build a communication base station that informs city landmarks, towns, etc. You can produce UAVs that navigate your borders to establish your first line of defense.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot become what we need to be, remaining what we are."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Max De Pree[NEWLINE][TAB]
Future Ballistics
Future Ballistics

The development and launch of artificial satellites has brought great advances in science and technology, particularly in space development. These technological advances did not simply push the boundaries of science, but served to enhance our understanding of the world and the universe. These technological leaps have also contributed significantly to the development and production of intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs). The technology of ICBMs is complex in itself and requires technological leaps in many of the areas that make it possible. Advanced physics, materials science, electromagnetics, and control systems are all critical factors in the design and implementation of these advanced weapon systems. Technological advances in these areas can be applied not only to ICBMs, but also to other types of missiles, spacecraft, and aircraft.
Can produce intercontinental ballistic missiles. Enhanced Operational Ability increases the abilities of Generals and Admirals. It can produce futuristic infantry power armor prostheses.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot become what we need to be, remaining what we are."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Max De Pree[NEWLINE][TAB]
Memetics
Memetics

Memetics is the study of the development and spread of memes -- self-contained units that carry cultural ideas, symbols, or practices that can be transmitted from one mind to another. They are considered by some to be a cultural analogue to genes, in the way they replicate, mutate, and respond to selective pressures. The study of memetics may help us understand how societies and cultures develop and evolve over time, although some suggest it may ultimately also help people manipulate and shape socieities into more desirable forms.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Entertainment Servers[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]VR Training Centres[ENDCOLOR] to help train veteran units. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Eco-Communes[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Not even the most heavily-armed police state can exert brute force to all of its citizens all of the time. Meme management is so much subtler; the rose-tinted refraction of perceived reality, the contagious fear of threatening alternatives."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Peter Watts, Blindsight[NEWLINE][TAB]
Autonomous Systems
Autonomous Systems

As cognitive technology advanced, fully autonomous mechanical systems became increasingly feasible. While not fully sentient or self-aware, these systems were capable of sufficiently complex decision-making that they could handle unexpected circumstances. This allowed human operators to provide simpler instructions and commands, and mechanical systems required less oversight, making them increasingly practical in real-world environments rather than controlled settings.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Advanced Destroyers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful naval melee unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Drone Hives[ENDCOLOR] which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Borehole[ENDCOLOR], which improves Geothermal Plants and Mines. Also allows Workers to construct [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Support Nodes[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and heal nearby units each turn.
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Never do anything yourself that others can do for you."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Agatha Christie, The Labours of Hercules[NEWLINE][TAB]
Hyperstructures
Hyperstructures

Expanding upon the concept of the arcology towards urban development, advances in materials engineering and other technologies may someday make it feasible to accomplish tremendous feats of engineering -- housing an entire city of people in a single structure, designed to optimize human comfort and society while minimizing their impact on the surrounding environment. Such a structure would be a tremendous accomplishment, and would undoubtably have an equally great impact upon human society.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Crawlers[ENDCOLOR], the most powerful siege unit, as well as [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Metroplex Hubs[ENDCOLOR], which provide [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men have become the tools of their tools"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - David Thoreau [NEWLINE][ TAB ]
Microscale Engineering

[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Infinities and indivisibles transcend our finite understanding, the former on account of their magnitude, the latter because of their smallness; Imagine what they are when combined."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Galileo Galilei[NEWLINE][TAB]
Homo Superior
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I teach you the Overman. Man is something which shall be surpassed."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Friedrich Nietzsche[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the full maturation of both biomodfication and cybernetics, it becomes possible to augment the human body in almost limitless ways. Human beings can be stronger, smarter, live longer and be relatively free from disease or injury. While there are ethical and even logistical concerns with such human augmentation, it would leave humanity poised to transcend its limitations.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Stasis Chamber[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Digital Society
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you stay right where you are, then people will eventually come to you."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Robert Doisneau[NEWLINE][TAB]

With the proliferation of artificial intelligences, as well as the advancement of cybernetics allowing humans to utilize mind-machine interfaces and telepresence, the concept of the mind and personality being linked to one's physical body becomes increasingly outmoded. Advances in computer networks and technology allow people to project themselves anywhere on the planet, or perceive entirely artifical worlds. Ultimately, such a society may discard concerns about the physical world, with identity being determined solely by one's mind, rather than one's body, and one's perceptions may be determined largely by one's interactions with the electronic environment humanity lives in.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Brain Uploading Facilities[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture but reduce population.
Smart Materials
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Everything changes, nothing remains without change."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Siddhārtha Gautama[NEWLINE][TAB]

The culimination of nanotechnology would be the development of "smart materials" -- materials that are actually comprised of intelligent nanomachines, capable of adapting themselves to their environments or other stimuli. Nanomachines like these, working in concert, would allow humans to have complete control over their environments -- construction shelters or other objects upon demand. Depending on the nature and distribution of the nanomachines, they could also serve other roles, such as personal defense or even transportation.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nexus[ENDCOLOR] units, a powerful carrier and support unit, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Utility Fog[ENDCOLOR], which improves city defense and increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Energy Theory
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Nikola Tesla [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

The human investigation of the principles under which the universe operates have lead to investigations of the functioning of the universe at the smallest and most high-energy states. The most evident products of this research can be found in the extended exploration and development of the solar system, resulting in powerful booster engines capable of propelling spacecraft between interplanetary colonies, as well as facilitating the development of new generations of space stations and bases on other worlds.

Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Boosters[ENDCOLOR], one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Factory[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Moon Base[ENDCOLOR].
Gene Acceleration
[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Man does not weave this web of life. He is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Chief Seattle[NEWLINE][TAB]

Dielectric acceleration is the pinnacle of life science, and humanity has challenged the realm of the gods. It is used to accelerate species evolution or to create new species. This scientific approach further enhances strategic depth on the battlefield, helping players create powerful units with special abilities. This technology is used in two main ways. First, "genetic enhancement" improves the genes of existing creatures, enhancing their abilities. It enhances characteristics such as health, speed, and intelligence, and the enhanced unit brings many advantages in battle. Second, "Gene Creation" is a way of creating new creatures, creating new units with unique combat-specific abilities. This can be seen as the ultimate tool created by mankind to challenge the realm of the gods.
You can produce genoswarms that move quickly and harass opponents, and biodrones, the ultimate recon unit.
Space Colonization
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"There is no easy way to the stars from the earth."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Seneca [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Humanity has always felt an underlying desire to explore and expand, to find what lies beyond the horizon. Outer space provides the ultimate frontier, a broad expanse that humanity can expand into and explore. The achievement of a level of technology that would permit humans to travel to another star system may be as pivotal in human history as the development of the first tools.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Engine[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Computronium
[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be."[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - George Orwell [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

Computronium is a material hypothesized by Norman Margolus and Tommaso Toffoli of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to be used as "programmable matter," a substrate for computer modeling of virtually any real object.
Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spaceship Cockpit[ENDCOLOR], which is one of the spaceship components required for the Science Victory.
Human Augmentation

[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ]"Mind you, I've always wondered if Kei wasn't one of those Yamashita upgrades -- you know, with too much adrenocorticotropic hormone, too little monoamine oxidase?"[NEWLINE][ TAB ][ TAB ] - Adam Warren, A Plague of Angels [NEWLINE][ TAB ]

With the development of both genetic biomodification and cybernetics, limitless possibilities for human augmentation became possible. Virtually any component of the human body could be replaced with a vat-grown or cybernetic replacement. Eventually, however, some began to see baseline humanity as the limitation, as it could only accept so much modification, and more experimentation began on establishing improved versions of the human genome.
Allows you to build [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Birthing Pods[ENDCOLOR], which increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Can produce carnage robots.
Build powerful railgun tanks that use nanomaterials.
Arcology

An arcology is a massive structure designed to be largely, if not fully, self-sustaining, providing a completely enclosed environment for a large number of citizens to work and live.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This custom improvement provides 2 [ICON_FOOD] Food and 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to the tile it's built on, with an additional +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if adjacent to a City, and +2 [ICON_GOLD] if adjacent to a Coast. Cannot be built adjacent to another Arcology.

This custom improvement provides 2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to the tile it's built on, with an additional +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if adjacent to a City, and +2 [ICON_GOLD] if adjacent to a Coast. Cannot be built adjacent to another Arcology.
Build an Arcology
Build an Arcology which increases the Food, Science and Gold yield of the tile. Gives 100% defense bonus.
It will increases the Food, Science and Gold yield of the tile.
Hydroponics Dome

Artificial methods of cultivating food have grown increasingly sophisticated over time. The advent of new technologies such as hydroponics and aeroponics means that crops can be cultivated in entirely artificial environments, and communities that would normally struggle to feed their citizens can now cultivate crops nearby without needing to import food from more fertile areas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This improvement provides additional +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food if built adjacent any Farms or Terraces nearby and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science to .

This custom improvement provides 3 [ICON_FOOD] Food, 2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to the tile it's built on. All adjacent Farms and Terraces gain +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Build a Hydroponics Dome
Build a Hydroponics Dome which increases the Food, Science and Production yields of the tile.
It will increase the Food, Science and Production yields of the tile.
Industrial Complex

The industrial complex is a socioeconomic concept wherein businesses become entwined in social or political systems or institutions, creating or bolstering a profit economy from these systems. Such a complex is said to pursue its own financial interests regardless of, and often at the expense of, the best interests of society and individuals. Businesses within an industrial complex may have been created to advance a social or political goal, but mostly profit when the goal is not reached. The industrial complex may profit financially from maintaining socially detrimental or inefficient systems. Increasingly large and complex collections of factories, assembly plants, foundries, and other such industrial buildings begin to appear, as industries are grouped together to help facilitate production and encourage economies of scale. While the Industrial Site isn't as fully effective as the Manufactory, it can still provide a significant boost to production. The concept was popularized by President Dwight Eisenhower in his Jan. 17, 1961 farewell speech. Eisenhower described a "threat to democratic government" called the military industrial complex. This complex involved the military establishment gaining "unwarranted influence" over the economic, political, and spiritual realms of American society due to the profitability of the US arms industry and the number of citizens employed in various branches of military service, the armaments industry, and other businesses providing goods to the US army. The "complex" arises from the creation of a multilateral economy serving military goals, as well as the paradox that arises from the goal of the multilateralism (sustained profit) as antithetical to the military's theoretical goal (peace).
This improvement provides 5 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Also adds 3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to every adjacent manufactory.

While a lot of research is still conducted on an academic and theoretical level, the tools required to explore the mysteries of quantum mechanics, astrophysics and particle physics require specialized high-tech laboratories and research centres.

Nature Preserve

Scientific advancement has given mankind an increasing number of tools with which to manipulate their environment, but this has also meant that pristine, natural environments have become increasingly scarce. Whether to preserve natural ecosystems, or to encourage an increasing ecotourism industry, more and more Nature Preserves are being set aside.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This improvement provides 3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science to the tile it's built on.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_CULTURE]Culture is additionally increased by +1 at campsites, Brazilian firewood lumberyards, polders and Nature Preserve adjacent to the tile.

Eco-Commune

With increasing awareness of the impact of urbanization upon the environment, there were numerous efforts to try and establish more environmentally friendly and sustainable communities. While these communities always remained somewhat small, particularly compared to the much denser arcologies that began to appear afterwards, they were self-sufficient, and their location in relatively unspoilt areas of the wilderness meant they had a certain appeal for ecotourists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This improvement provides +1 [ICON_FOOD] to any Farms or Terraces adjacent.

Support Node

As military units became increasingly sophisticated, it also became increasingly difficult to help maintain their equipment in the field. Fungal Growth Farm

The most visible effect of the release of the Pholus Mutagen has been the mutation of plants into fungal growths. The unusual plant forms have been observed to developing neural-like structures that allow them to interpret sensory information from their environments, and even respond with toxins and biochemical attacks against those they consider hostile, making areas overrun by the fungus to be quite hazardous for those unprepared for them to traverse. However, the fungus itself also appears to be living in symbiosis with humans and animals affected by the mutagen, providing them with useful sustenance and other valuable materials such as pharmaceuticals.

This custom improvement provides 2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, 2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, and 2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to the tile it's built on. It also inflicts 10 HP damage on any units that end their turn on or adjacent to it.

Nuclear Vault

A fallout shelter is an enclosed space specially designated to protect occupants from radioactive debris or fallout resulting from a nuclear explosion. Many such shelters were constructed as civil defense measures during the Cold War. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]During a nuclear explosion, matter vaporized in the resulting fireball is exposed to neutrons from the explosion, absorbs them, and becomes radioactive. When this material condenses in the rain, it forms dust and light sandy materials that resemble ground pumice. The fallout emits alpha and beta particles, as well as gamma rays. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Much of this highly radioactive material falls to Earth, subjecting anything within the line of sight to radiation, becoming a significant hazard. A fallout shelter is designed to allow its occupants to minimize exposure to harmful fallout until radioactivity has decayed to a safer level.
The Nuclear Vault functions both as a Missile Silo and Fallout Shelter. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can stash up to 3 Nuclear Missiles and provides Fallout Immunity to units stationed on this tile.
